messages.message:
In other news, this ended up being a decent answer, but references a pretty old doc that needs updating. We have other sources where this should have been pulled from to get full accuracy:

What are ways to securely connect to a SaaS deployment?

Response
To securely connect to a SaaS deployment, the following methods and practices are recommended:
1. Single Sign-On (SSO): This allows customers to control platform access securely*[1] (https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1Cml_Vo0hThFJkBGs73u5bafTm_R3MnSHDdyZQ5l4iZg/edit?usp=drivesdk)*.
2. Network Configuration: The platform can be configured to ensure there is no public internet access, which helps prevent security risks and threats*[1] (https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1Cml_Vo0hThFJkBGs73u5bafTm_R3MnSHDdyZQ5l4iZg/edit?usp=drivesdk)*.
3. Mounting Customerâ€™s Existing Cloud Storage: This ensures that customers remain in control of their data*[1] (https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1Cml_Vo0hThFJkBGs73u5bafTm_R3MnSHDdyZQ5l4iZg/edit?usp=drivesdk)*.
4. Single-Tenant Deployments: These ensure complete isolation between customers and internal business units as needed*[1] (https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1Cml_Vo0hThFJkBGs73u5bafTm_R3MnSHDdyZQ5l4iZg/edit?usp=drivesdk)*.
5. Compliance with Security Standards: The system is designed to be compliant with GDPR, SOC2 Type 2 certification (US, UK, EU), and HIPAA attestation*[1] (https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1Cml_Vo0hThFJkBGs73u5bafTm_R3MnSHDdyZQ5l4iZg/edit?usp=drivesdk)*.
